newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Palestinian Authority releases jailed Hamas leader.
newsitem.headline: Palestinian Authority releases jailed Hamas leader.

text.p: The Palestinian Authority has released a leader of the militant Hamas movement nine months after it jailed him without trial in the wake of suicide bombings in Israel, officials said on Monday.
Sheikh Ahmed Nimr, arrested last March, was freed from detention in self-ruled Gaza on Sunday, Hamas and PLO officials said.
Nimr is widely regarded as one of the spiritual fathers of Hamas. The Islamic group's spiritual leader, Sheikh Ahmed Yassin, has been imprisoned in Israel since 1989.
Hamas officials said about 200 activists in the movement were still being held in the Gaza Strip, some without charge, by Palestinian security authorities.
Palestinian security forces rounded up nearly 1,000 alleged Hamas activists after suicide bombers acting on behalf of the movement's military wing killed 59 people in Israel last February and March.
In a report issued on Monday, Amnesty International criticised what it called a worrying increase in human rights abuses by the Palestinian Authority over the past two years.
The London-based human rights organisation said these included the "arbitrary political arrest and prolonged detention without charge or trial of hundreds of suspected political opponents".
